channel.title: ASF JIRA
channel.description: This file is an XML representation of an issue

item.title: [HBASE-14814] HDFS UI port clashes cause test fails
item.description: In test runs, HDFS UI can clash when concurrent test runs.
item.summary: HDFS UI port clashes cause test fails

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.

comments.comment:
Here is how it looks on fail:


Error Message



Port in use: localhost:0

Stacktrace



java.net.BindException: Port in use: localhost:0

Here....https://builds.apache.org/view/H-L/view/HBase/job/HBase-1.2/370/#showFailuresLink

I could try and choose random ports for UI if not done already to make this happen less often.

I check some failed test case log, and NOT think it is caused by 'HDFS UI port already in use'.

I post some failed test case stack trace here.

They are NN RPC port, DN RPC port, DN Xceiver port..... Of course, include HDFS Web UI port.

They all try to bind localhost:0, it is very weird!
It seems all test cases failed to read configuration xml. wdyt? stack

They all try to bind localhost:0, it is very weird!

I've not looked. Have we configured them to choose random port – i.e. 0 – and they are failing? Maybe we could catch these exceptions and do a retry. TODO.
